synopsis: Ekoda-chan is a girl in her twenties struggling to make ends meet while enjoying life. After being taken on a tour through her routine, stay for a discussion between the director of episode 1, Daichi Akitaro (Kodomo no Omocha, Now and There Here and Then, Sexy Commando) and it's star, former AKB48 member Ishida Haruka.
Ekoda-chan ponders the long dark night of the soul, featuring director Sugii Gisaburo (Glass Mask, Touch, Street Fighter) and Romi Park (Fullmetal Alchemist, Attack on Titan).

Ekoda-chan and her friends go through a bit of a redesign, in this short brought to you by Shigino Akira (Crayon Shin-chan movies, Yatterman 2008) and Tatsumi Yuiko (Etotama, The Irregular at Magic High School).
We get a closer look at Ekoda-chan's relationship with Maa-kun through the creative vision of Mochizuki Tomomi (Ranma 1/2, Code Geass) and Chiba Chiemi (Kirakira â˜† Precure a la Mode, Rozen Maiden).

It's a clash no one was expecting when Ekoda-chan is forced to take on an array of invaders in apartment, brought to you by Yonetani Yoshitomo (Gaogaigar, Food Wars) and Shishido Rumi (Tales of Innocence, Xenosaga).
Get a peak inside Ekoda-chan's psychology with director Takahashi Ryosuke (Young Black Jack, Gasaraki) and Mimori Suzuko (Ultraman Geed, Revue Starlight).
Get ready for an exciting yarn starring Ekoda, brought to you by director Misawa Shin (Gingitsune, Kodomo no Jikan) and Doi Mika (Super Dimensional Fortress Macross, Rurouni Kenshin).
We get a look at the way the people around her view Ekoda, as pictured by Kojima Masayuki (Made in Abyss, Monster) and voiced by Ise Mariya (Hunter x Hunter, Hanebado).
